comments.content: It's definitely difficult and rewarding at the same time. Two entirely different worlds colliding. The language part isn't an issue...learn English and/or learn that persons language. Something brought you together in the first place...maybe attraction...which isn't a horrible place to start. Keep the momentum going after that. All normal relationship rules apply after that, don't be disrespectful. If the desire to move forward together is there, then the ways you do it will be trivial and you'll succeed.
I can accept it since I think it's a different experience. Not until we try once can we know the advantage and disadvantage. By exchanging thought can we open our sight

I think love has no limitation, I am so sure that you should go for it if you have been involved with this cross cultural relationship. Take a look at the clip below, good luck

comments.content: I have no difference to it. love is love.
Culture experience exchanging is good. I'm pretty sure the Asian is more considerate than the Caucasian. But the Caucasian is more romantic than the Asian.

I pretty into that sort of relationship. Cause in my experience , I could have more common ideas and good time with foreigners.
I think people who against CCR are mostly feel threatened.

Personally, I never cared for cross culture relationship.
I mean sure, you might be attracted to each other, but the cultural difference is always a large barrier to overcome.
At the end of the day, you have to compromise one or the other's culture to stay in the relationship.
But hey, if you don't mind it, why not go for it.

Honestly cross culture relationship are not really unacceptable for me. The impression for ccr in Taiwanese is too bad for people to accept  but in my opinion that's few experience but people keep share with other by media. Maybe it's a good experience to share your culture with different background. Depend on what to you think about this.

True feeling is more powerful than language.
True love is strong enough to overcome cultural differences.
True love transcends barriers of languages and cultures.
